title: CryptSafe
author: CryptSafe
content: The journey so far on this platform has not been that easy. At first it was a panic and frightening one as I was afraid of being kicked out of the platform as a newbie who knows nothing much on how the forum operates.. I became nervous and also was careful of my words, works and activities here and gradually building myself on bitcoin information and education. I had to read through the forum policies, guidelines and posts from high ranked and reputable members here to keep abreast. In other to be a part of the bitcoin movement after the much studies here I had to take the bitcoin movement to my locality where I recorded many huge successes for which I uploaded here for the community to see some of my works while some I did not bother uploading them. So far the awareness and adoption I had engaged are very much successful (you are free to check my created topics on my bio to see my uploads)Achieving a thousand post here  isn't an easy task as It took me commitment, zeal, passion, dedication and encouragement from which I drew my strength. The following  board members I would salute for their encouragement; @The Cryptovator, @fillippone, @The Sceptical Chymist, @Yahoo62278, @Royse777, @CryptopreneurBrainboss, @Igebotz @Ratimov, @o_e_l_e_o, @DdmrDdmr, @JayJuanGee, @LoyceV @lionheart78 and lots too many to mention.I would not forget to talk about my campaign experience. At first, my first campaign I applied for was managed by @yahoo62278. It was very interesting and competitive so I had to put in all my best to making sure I maintained my spot a as member rank. It also sharpened and shaped me more on making good contributions in  posts and comments which I had built my base on till the campaign was finally over and it was a successful one as I rose through ranks and I was not removed. Secondly, @Royse777 managed the second campaign I applied for and I was successfully accepted into the campaign which is still currently running. I also have learnt a lot from his management as he contributed in making me good at my work. I further developed the passion  in continuity and exercise for which I had long started on this platform and achieving successes. Many would say a thousand post isn't a new thing as many have climbed above it but to me it is a fit achieved as the task is not as easy as they think it is. I know my activities are gradually building likewise my rank  which requires me more merits but commitment and good contributions are my goals as I appeal for a review on my works, post and contributions to be merited accordingly.Lastly, I will also use this medium to encourage new members joining bitcointalk platform to make it a priority by first reading through the forum policies and guidelines so as to be able to  make good contributions and know how the platform operates in other for them to be able to scale through without having any issues.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Why the Bitcoin discussion? I think this achievement would have a better reputation.Congratulations on achieving 1000 posts! You are older than me in the forum based on time of registration. I will share my achievement someday too, but it won't be about the post number.

comments.author: MainIbem
comments.body: Well I understand how you are feeling currently isn't that easy to be able to achieve a thousand post though despite i have climbed above that but i know how it tells on me during my time of starting this journey. It is very hard to work on this road but with commitment and devotion in reading every post words to words for you to be able to understand what they saying or what the board is really saying is were the problems lies, i have seen lots of newbies who just came onboard starts carving and crazy for merits while looking at their post they hardly make good contribution to the forum that could warrants them earn good merits that may likely positioned them to the next rank they desired. I won't have to go more further because I believe this is not your end rather is just beginning I believe there are more bigger things to come. So I join hands say Congratulations on reaching 1k post. Just as Nwada001 said earlier it will be ideal you move this thread to the reputation board here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=129.0 Goodluck!

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: 1000 posts is not all that of a milestone to create a thread for, i think celebrations of this sort should be reserved for actual milestones, if users begin to create threads for what they subjectively think is a milestone, it could really get messy out here.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: There's now a thread created by @BitcoinGirl.Club if the OP wants to celebrate a milestone achievement then do so in that thread.Many people have passed this post, I know you are happy with the achievements for more than 1 year with 1000 posts, but better on the threads provided.[1] Announce your rank up, merit or any achievements that makes you feel great!

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Congratulations, I thought it was 10,000 posts but 1000 posts is still a tough number. Why is your experience limited to campaign signatures, it is a small part of the forum, try to visit more boards and you will discover more information.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: This is different from the usual new rank self congratulatory thread, I don’t think number of posts is something to be considered a milestone, it’s not the post count that matters it’s your overall performance regarding quality of your posts that really matters. If I had my post counts and merit on a even scale then I would consider making it a thing to celebrate but to each his own.

When users achieve something they feel proud about, I think they deserve to get a little recognition. It depends on the user as well. A bounty hunter with only POA posts need not make a thread like this.Congrats on your achievement CryptSafe, maybe you'll stick around for 1000 more.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: Patrol69 on May 01, 2023, 01:16:00 PMAlthough 1000 posts is not a milestone we can still congratulate him.It takes effort to make 1000 posts, and I think that's a milestone that anyone should probably celebrate for their consistent activity.Some would say it's not milestone worth celebrating, but otherwise I feel it's worth celebrating especially if you're a user who has good quality posts. But anyway, I thought it would be great idea to post celebration like this in one of the provided thread, it will keep the reputation board main page views in order. @CryptSafe, keep up the good work and congrats on your new milestone. 1000 posts doesn't mean much if they are just spam or useless, but you look different. Stay consistent, your journey in this forum is still too young and you still need to get some more new milestones in the coming years.
